Least PIE of all. Less PIE than Kartvelian and Georgian

armenian history

Many words are very IE of cause.

stone քար kʿar kʰɑɾ 𒄴 𒄯 ḪAR quartz chert

Some Egyptian words are very Armenian :

𓇳 արեւ ɑˈɾɛv ⇔ era year Jahre
𓈙 "sea" ծով cov t͡sɔv ზღვა zɣva
𓎡 𓎡 𓇰 | 𒈪 GIG գիշեր ɡiʃɛɾ @ Armenian
𓐠 𓏤 𓂋 𓏤 𓏘 𓅱 𓇲 𓏤𓏤𓏤 | sꜣrꜣq սառույց saṙuycʿ sɑˈrujt͡sʰ < šar.ice snow hoarfrost
𓅂 թռչել tʿṙč track trag "fly"
𓏱 մեռնել meṙnel mɛrˈnɛl die ⇔ mourn
𓈞 𓊃 𓀉 նստել nstel nəsˈtɛl hinstell hinsettle
𓇥 𓂋 𓆓 𓄔 տերեւ tɛˈɾɛv "leaf" ⇔ tail?
𓋴 𓌢 𓈖 𓂉 շնչել šnčʿel breathe !

𒌗 Le'Sîn լուսին lusin luˈsin lu'ne "moon"

The Armenian Highland shows traces of settlement from the Neolithic era. Archaeological surveys in 2010 and 2011 have resulted in the discovery of the world's earliest known leather shoe (3,500 BC), straw skirt (3,900 BC), and wine-making facility (4,000 BC) at the Areni-1 cave complex.

The Shulaveri-Shomu culture of the central Transcaucasus region is one of the earliest known prehistoric cultures in the area, carbon-dated to roughly 6000–4000 BC.

An early Bronze-Age culture in the area is the Kura-Araxes culture, assigned to the period between c. 4000 and 2200 BC, it spread to Georgia by 3000 BC.
